docs.text: Introduction ¶ Welcome ¶ This document gives a summary of the requests received by the wagonmartservices application and the structure of the response the application returns. The response will be common for both web client and mobile apps (iOS and Android), unless otherwise specified. For more visit this repo . JSON only works here The server accepts only JSON media Type. So send your requests with application/json charset=utf-8 Request data should be raw, not form data The jwt token, warehouse id and client properties (source of request, browser details in web application, device details in apps etc) will be included in the Http Header. All the services which uses HTTP Post should send the data as raw data and not form-data. Seo-Urls, Seo-Keywords, Title and descriptions for categories, brands, products etc are used to make the web site SEO friendly. Http Headers ¶ There are two HTTP headers which should be present with all the requests to the server. warehouseId token (for authenticating user for a logged in user)
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Basics ¶ There are 32 services for this applications. The different types of service calls, their parameters and responses are described below. Acknowledgement ¶ Acknowledgement data will be present in all the responses. The status will be the overall status of the request action. The ‘message’ will be the message from the server that can be displayed to the end users. The structure will be: Typescript export interface AcknowledgementResponse { acknowledgement : Acknowledgement } export interface Acknowledgement { message : string status : string } JSON { "acknowledgement" : { "message" : "Categories successfully populated" , "status" : "SUCCESS" } }
docs.title: Basics

docs.text: Brands ¶ Lists the brands available. Add limit and offset parameters for pagination. Request details API Endpoint : /brands Request type : GET Payload : limit , offset Parameter details ¶ limit - the number of items that will listed. offset - the number after which the items will be listed. Response ¶ Typescript export interface BrandsResponse { acknowledgement : Acknowledgement ; brands : Brand []; } export interface Acknowledgement { status : string ; message : string ; } export interface Brand { brandName : string ; brandId : string ; brandImageUrl : string ; brandSeoUrl : string ; brandSeoKeywords : string ; brandDescription : string ; } JSON { "acknowledgement" : { "status" : "" , "message" : "" }, "brands" : [ { "brandName" : "" , "brandId" : "" , "brandImageUrl" : "" , "brandSeoUrl" : "" , "brandSeoKeywords" : "" , "brandDescription" : "" } ] }

docs.text: Contents of a combo product ¶ This service is to get the contents of a particular combo product. This service has the same response of the product listing service. Request details API Endpoint : /products/{productId}/related/contents Request type : GET Payload : None Object Details ¶ productListInfo - This object will have the meta information about the list being populated. Values include the total rating out of which the individual rating will be based on, minimum price the cart total should be to proceed to checkout and the maximum quantity of a single SKU that can be added to the online/offline cart. product : This array will hold the list of products. brand : This object will hold the details of the brand of the product. rating : This object will hold a summary of the product ratings. skus : This object will hold the information of the product SKUs. docs.text: Locations ¶ The main locations and serving sub locations will be populated under this service. Autocompletion of the sublocation will be done in the UI. The user will select a main location from a dropdown list provided. On selecting a main location , all the sublocations attached to the main location will be populated in the attached second dropdown list. Once the user has selected a sublocation from the list, the corresponding warehouse Id will be added in the Http header for all subsequent requests. Request details API Endpoint : /locations Request type : GET Payload : None Response ¶ Typescript export interface LocationResponse { acknowledgement : Acknowledgement ; location : Location []; } export interface Acknowledgement { message : string ; status : string ; } export interface Location { mainLocationId : string ; mainLocationName : string ; subLocation : SubLocation []; } export interface SubLocation { subLocationId : string ; subLocationName : string ; warehouseId : string ; } JSON { "acknowledgement" : { "message" : "Locations populations successfull" , "status" : "SUCCESS" }, "location" : [ { "mainLocationId" : "1" , "mainLocationName" : "Calicut" , "subLocation" : [ { "subLocationId" : "17" , "subLocationName" : " Malcha Marg-110021,Delhi" , "warehouseId" : "32" }, { "subLocationId" : "20" , "subLocationName" : "Ajnara Grand Heritage-201301,Delhi" , "warehouseId" : "32" } ] } ] }
docs.title: Locations

docs.text: Products under a category ¶ This service is to list all the products from a particular category. Request details API Endpoint : /categories/{categoryId}/products Request type : GET Payload : limit , offset , discountMin , discountMax , priceStart , priceEnd , brand Lists products under the category specified by the {categoryId} . In the absence of any limit or offset values, the server will take a default limit which will be read from the configurations file and 0 as offset . Use the limits The client developers are advised to use the limit and offset parameters to reduce the loading times. Else the loading time will increase inifinitely. Parameter details ¶ limit - the number of items that will listed. offset - the number after which the items will be listed. minDiscount - filter parameter for minimum discount maxDiscount - filter parameter for maximum discount startPrice - filter parameter for start price endPrice - filter parameter for end price brands - filter parameter for brands (comma seperated brand Id) Object Details ¶ productListInfo - This object will have the meta information about the list being populated. Values include the total rating out of which the individual rating will be based on, minimum price the cart total should be to proceed to checkout and the maximum quantity of a single SKU that can be added to the online/offline cart. product : This array will hold the list of products. brand : This object will hold the details of the brand of the product. rating : This object will hold a summary of the product ratings. skus : This object will hold the information of the product SKUs. docs.text: Products under a category ¶ This service is to list all the products from a particular category. Request details API Endpoint : /categories/{categoryId}/products Request type : GET Payload : limit , offset , discountMin , discountMax , priceStart , priceEnd , brand Lists products under the category specified by the {categoryId} . In the absence of any limit or offset values, the server will take a default limit which will be read from the configurations file and 0 as offset . Use the limits The client developers are advised to use the limit and offset parameters to reduce the loading times. Else the loading time will increase inifinitely. Parameter details ¶ limit - the number of items that will listed. offset - the number after which the items will be listed. minDiscount - filter parameter for minimum discount maxDiscount - filter parameter for maximum discount startPrice - filter parameter for start price endPrice - filter parameter for end price brands - filter parameter for brands (comma seperated brand Id) Object Details ¶ productListInfo - This object will have the meta information about the list being populated. Values include the total rating out of which the individual rating will be based on, minimum price the cart total should be to proceed to checkout and the maximum quantity of a single SKU that can be added to the online/offline cart. product : This array will hold the list of products. brand : This object will hold the details of the brand of the product. rating : This object will hold a summary of the product ratings. skus : This object will hold the information of the product SKUs. docs.text: Order Review ¶ Get order review ¶ The user will be able to add a rating and review their order only after they have received the item, that is only after the order has been delivered. Request details API Endpoint : /orders/{orderId}/reviews Request type : GET Payload : limit , offset Parameter details ¶ limit - the number of items that will listed. offset - the number after which the items will be listed. Response ¶ Typescript export interface OrderReviewResponse { acknowledgement : Acknowledgement ; ratingInfo : RatingInfo ; rating : Rating ; review : WelcomeReview ; } export interface Acknowledgement { status : string ; message : string ; } export interface Rating { individualRating : IndividualRating ; } export interface IndividualRating { starOneRating : string ; starTwoRating : string ; starThreeRating : string ; starFourRating : string ; starFiveRating : string ; } export interface RatingInfo { totalRating : string ; } export interface WelcomeReview { totalReviews : string ; reviews : ReviewElement []; } export interface ReviewElement { reviewComment : string ; reviewUser : string ; userRating : string ; } JSON { "acknowledgement" : { "status" : "" , "message" : "" }, "ratingInfo" : { "totalRating" : "" }, "rating" : { "individualRating" : { "starOneRating" : "" , "starTwoRating" : "" , "starThreeRating" : "" , "starFourRating" : "" , "starFiveRating" : "" } }, "review" : { "totalReviews" : "" , "reviews" : [ { "reviewComment" : "" , "reviewUser" : "" , "userRating" : "" } ] } } Add order review ¶ The rating and review can only be done on order which has been delivered to the user(The status of the order has been updated by the appropriate warehouse user) and the order has not been rated or reviewed yet. To this end, with the order details API response, a canReview boolean is sent. If the Boolean is true, the allow the user to rate/review the order. Request details API Endpoint : /orders/{orderId}/reviews Request type : POST Payload : Object Payload object ¶ Typescript export interface OrderReviewRequest { type : ReviewType rating : string review : string } export enum ReviewType { PRODUCT = 'PRODUCT' , ORDER = 'ORDER' } JSON { "type" : "ORDER" , "rating" : "5" , "review" : "This products is blah blah ..." } Response ¶ Typescript export interface OrderReviewResponse { acknowledgement : Acknowledgement ; ratingInfo : RatingInfo ; rating : Rating ; review : OrderReview ; } export interface Acknowledgement { status : string ; message : string ; } export interface Rating { individualRating : IndividualRating ; } export interface IndividualRating { starOneRating : string ; starTwoRating : string ; starThreeRating : string ; starFourRating : string ; starFiveRating : string ; } export interface RatingInfo { totalRating : string ; } export interface OrderReview { totalReviews : string ; reviews : Review []; } export interface Review { reviewComment : string ; reviewUser : string ; userRating : string ; } JSON { "acknowledgement" : { "status" : "" , "message" : "" }, "ratingInfo" : { "totalRating" : "" }, "rating" : { "individualRating" : { "starOneRating" : "" , "starTwoRating" : "" , "starThreeRating" : "" , "starFourRating" : "" , "starFiveRating" : "" } }, "review" : { "totalReviews" : "" , "reviews" : [ { "reviewComment" : "" , "reviewUser" : "" , "userRating" : "" } ] } }
